poem:
Title: In the Tide of Unyielding Time

The mariner, not villain but victim,
Tethered between surfeit water and ebbing hope,
Oxford's glistening mourner, his wealth drained
By matrimony's puncture, a life re-cast.
Nature, relentless, teaches its fiercest lessons,
In the ironic deluge of sorrow's river,
An echo of ten-year torment.
In the heart of unaffordable empires,
He finds solace, where reeds whisper his story. 

— RS Thomas
